intro: Delissea floribunda, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Delissea floribunda is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
